Here is the April 29th update from the LU-T District:

INTERNET SAFETY

Due to this extended closure, students are spending more time than ever online on their Chromebooks, tablets, phones, and other electronic devices. While sometimes it seems our students know more than we do about technology, we wanted to take this week to share resources about internet and social media safety. If you did not get the email from the School Counselors with these internet safety resources, please email Jennifer.Blackstone@libertyunion.org to be added to the contact list.

While our schools have the ability to monitor searches and activity on school issued Chromebooks, we know it is not realistic for you to be watching every click your child might make when on their personal devices. Young people are often quick to make decisions without thinking through the potential consequences (due largely to their stage in brain development), so it can be up to the adults in their lives to help guide them in learning how to best use online resources and social media.

CONTROLLED BURN

Completely unrelated to the current COVID-19 situation, the Liberty Union-Thurston Local School District will be having a controlled burn of an area behind the middle school building near the Land Lab entrance. The school district is working in conjunction with the Basil Joint Fire District, the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency, and the Ohio Department of Natural Resources for this burn. The school district has partnered with a Fish and Wildlife Biologist from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. Upon his recommendation, some of the prairie grasses behind the middle school need a fresh start and a controlled burn is an effective solution.

This controlled burn, under supervision of Basil Joint Fire District, will occur on FRIDAY, APRIL 3rd. The planned time of the burn is 4:00 P.M. However, that time may need to be adjusted slightly depending on wind conditions. Please do not be alarmed if you see fire trucks, smoke, or fire near the middle school on Friday anytime in the afternoon.
